message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll be very interested in. I'm willing to offer it to you for $14000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Can you meet me at that price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $12000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $13500. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you consider $13000?
I understand that you're still a bit short on budget, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer you the product for $13250. This is as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $13250 and my target price of $12000. Can you consider $12750?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you the product for $13000, which is my minimum price. This is as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you at $12500. Can you consider that?

I'm not willing to go any lower than my minimum price of $13000. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I can include a free installation and a one-year warranty. If you're still interested, I can meet you at $13000. What do you think?
I appreciate the extras, but I'm still not willing to pay $13000. I'm willing to meet you at $12500, and I'll even throw in a small payment upfront to seal the deal. Can you consider that?
